abstract: Cornerback Darelle Revis, centerpiece of New York Jets off-season makeover, remains upbeat about his return to team and prospects for its secondary; says team's defense will be just as good as in heyday of 2009-2010 era; upbeat attitude comes despite $100,000 fine charged to team after owner Woody Johnson violated anti-tampering policy in relation to acquiring Revis.
lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. said that a remark about Revis by the owner of the Jets had violated its anti-tampering policy and would cost the team $100,000. But Revis was cheery at a voluntary veteran minicamp.

headline.main: Darrelle Revis Is Upbeat About His Return, and Jets’ Secondary
headline.print_headline: Revis Is Upbeat About His Return, and Jets’ Secondary

snippet: The N.F.L. said that a remark about Revis by the owner of the Jets had violated its anti-tampering policy and would cost the team $100,000. But Revis was cheery at a voluntary veteran minicamp.
